blocks.text: The architecture must keep playback fast and scrolling smooth. Treat this as a client pipeline: feed shell + visibility tracking + prefetch manager + media loader + playback controller. The UI should be driven by a single active player and a bounded cache.

**Client architecture**
- Feed shell + virtualized list
- Visibility observer (viewport + direction)
- Video card component with lifecycle hooks
- Prefetch manager (next 2-3)
- Playback controller (single active player)

**Delivery pipeline**
- CDN for segmented media
- Adaptive bitrate (ABR) selection
- Client cache with TTL + LRU
- Retry + fallback for slow networks
- Analytics hooks for playback health

blocks.title: Core modules to mention
rows: Controls DOM size and scroll performance

steps.title: 1) Fetch metadata
steps.text: Load feed metadata (id, poster, media URLs, duration) and render the first card.

steps.title: 2) Start playback
steps.text: When the first card enters the viewport, the PlaybackController starts playback and records TTFF.

steps.title: 3) Prefetch
steps.text: PrefetchManager schedules the next 2-3 videos based on scroll direction and idle time.

steps.title: 4) Adapt quality
steps.text: ABR chooses a lower bitrate on slow networks; upgrade when stable.

steps.title: 5) Cleanup
steps.text: Pause offscreen videos, cancel downloads, and evict cache entries via LRU.

blocks.title: Key message
blocks.text: You win by controlling the pipeline: visibility drives playback, a small prefetch window drives instant play, and a bounded cache keeps memory predictable.
